intro: Pandiaka glabra, commonly known as the smooth pandiaka, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles.
